topics.title: Australian International Summer
topics.summary: Tracking squads, injuries, and momentum as Australia hosts India and Pakistan across formats.
topics.curatedCopy:
## Summer storyline
Australia opens the Border-Gavaskar Trophy under lights in Perth before a quick-turnaround ODI series. Selectors are balancing Shield form, player workloads, and an expanded bowling group ahead of the New Zealand tour.

### What we're watching
- Mitchell Marsh's captaincy cadence with Cummins rotating.
- Cameron Green's Shield form compared to Matt Renshaw and Marcus Harris.
- How Alyssa Healy's return shapes dual men's and women's Test preparations.

callouts.title: Why it matters
callouts.markdown:
- India arrive with a near full-strength attack, demanding fresh plans for Australian batters.
- Dual men's and women's Tests at Optus Stadium require careful pitch preparation and squad balance.

callouts.title: Injury watch
callouts.markdown: Mitchell Starc is being managed through groin soreness while Ellyse Perry completes modified training after back spasms.

events.title: Australia confirms Perth Test squad
events.description: Selectors back Marcus Harris to open with Khawaja while Cameron Green is earmarked for No. 4 after blistering Shield form.

events.title: Healy cleared for day-night Test
events.description: Alyssa Healy passes fitness tests to lead the Southern Stars, freeing Phoebe Litchfield to bat in her preferred role.

events.title: Gabba ODI moved to twilight slot
events.description: Cricket Australia adjusts start times to maximise prime-time coverage after ticket demand surges above 35,000.

topics.title: Big Bash League Watch
topics.summary: Roster shuffles, draft picks, and tactical tweaks as BBL|14 and WBBL|10 hit full stride.
topics.curatedCopy:
## League pulse
Clubs are finalising marquee signings while trialling rule tweaks in practice matches. Expect more power-surge gambles, floating finishers, and aggressive use of local replacement players as international windows tighten.

### Key talking points
1. Brisbane Heat prioritising pace depth with Spencer Johnson on managed loads.
2. Melbourne Stars banking on Glenn Maxwell's fitness and a rookie wicketkeeper rotation.
3. Sydney Sixers launching community hubs alongside every home game.

callouts.title: Fan experience
callouts.markdown: Member upgrades now include behind-the-scenes streaming from changerooms and mic'd-up warm-ups.

events.title: Heat open training draws 5,000 fans
events.description: Brisbane Heat unveil their fearless blueprint with live-streamed power surge simulations and junior clinics.

events.title: Stars confirm dual-keeper tactic
events.description: Melbourne Stars rotate young wicketkeepers for specific matchups, freeing Glenn Maxwell for outfield duties.

events.title: Sixers launch pink community hub
events.description: Game-day village at the SCG features women in sport panels, accessible seating upgrades, and pop-up clinics.

topics.title: Domestic Pathways & Grassroots
topics.summary: Sheffield Shield, WNCL, and Premier Cricket performances fuelling the next wave of national call-ups.
topics.curatedCopy:
## Development watch
Pathway coaches highlight how Premier Cricket and National Championships inform rookie contracts. Technology from the National Cricket Centre is filtering down through state hubs, giving analysts richer data on emerging talent.

### Spotlight programs
- Woolworths Cricket Blast expanding to remote communities.
- National under-19 tournament streamed in high definition for the first time.
- Hybrid turf wicket trials in the Northern Territory to extend playing seasons.

callouts.title: Talent radar
callouts.markdown: Leg-spinner Emily Smith (WA) and quick Tom Straker (SA) named as Academy priority picks after standout performances.

events.title: Shield marathon in Adelaide lights up selectors
events.description: Queensland and SA share honours in a day-night epic showcasing quick prospects topping 145kph.

events.title: Club grants fund hybrid wickets
events.description: Northern Territory clubs secure infrastructure upgrades to extend dry-season playing windows.

items.title: Marcus Harris gets nod for Perth Test opener
items.content: Selectors stick with Harris alongside Khawaja while hinting at a flexible middle order for the pink-ball Test.

items.title: Cameron Green ton heaps pressure on incumbents
items.content: Green's unbeaten 142 for WA adds weight to calls for a middle-order reshuffle ahead of India.

items.title: Healy declares herself ready for pink-ball Test
items.content: Captain confirms she will keep wicket after completing running loads at the National Cricket Centre.

items.title: Gabba ODI rescheduled to twilight slot
items.content: Cricket Australia adjusts start times to maximise broadcast reach after crowd demand surpasses expectations.

items.title: Heat unveil fearless brand ahead of BBL opener
items.content: Brisbane Heat roll out their fast-paced blueprint with open training attracting record pre-season crowds.

items.title: Stars back dual-keeper strategy for BBL|14
items.content: Coach Peter Moores reveals the Stars will alternate keepers to maximise matchups and power surge options.

items.title: Sixers launch pink community hub at the SCG
items.content: New match-day precinct features women in sport panels, sensory spaces, and inclusive seating upgrades.

items.title: Shield day-nighter showcases new quicks
items.content: Rising pacemen Tom Straker and Liam Haskett headline a gripping draw that boosts their national credentials.

items.title: National Championships stream hits record viewers
items.content: High-definition coverage of the under-19 nationals draws scouts and fans, highlighting prospects from every state.

items.title: Hybrid wicket trials funded across the NT
items.content: Grassroots clubs secure grants to install hybrid surfaces, extending the season and reducing maintenance costs.
